Events.OnCreate:
(block () (switch ; See if the mission is still available
(not (benedict_isMissionAvailable (objGetType gSource))) (msnDestroy gSource)
; Only valid in system C6A (or C6)
(!= (sysGetNode) (if (find (sysGetNodes) 'C6A) 'C6A 'C6)) (msnDestroy gSource)
; Must have completed Sandoval mission
(not (msnFind "r +unid:&msFindHandOfSolace;; +property:isSuccess;")) (msnDestroy gSource)
; OK ) )
Events.OnAcceptedUndock:
(block ( (ownerObj (objGetObjByID (msnGetProperty gSource 'ownerID))) (targetObj (objGetObjByID (msnGetData gSource 'targetID)))
(newReactor (itmCreate &it100MWReactor; 1))
(oldShipObj gPlayerShip) newShipObj )
; Remember the player's old ship.
(msnSetData gSource 'playerShipID (objGetID gPlayerShip))
; Deal with all of the player's wingmen
(enum (sysFindObject gPlayerShip "sA +property:playerWingman;") theWingman (block ( (targetSov (objGetProperty theWingman 'sovereign)) (curOrders (shpGetOrder theWingman)) ) ; If our wingman is not currently escorting us, then order them ; to return (if they ARE escorting us, then they will stay with the ; old player ship).
(if (and (!= curOrders 'escort) (!= curOrders 'follow) (!= curOrders 'hold) ) (objCommunicate theWingman gPlayerShip 'msgFormUp) )
; Set the sovereign so that it is friends with the new infiltration ; sovereign.
(if (and (!= targetSov &svBenedict06Infiltrate;) (!= targetSov &svCommonwealth;) ) (block () (sovSetDisposition &svBenedict06Infiltrate; targetSov 'friend) (sovSetDisposition targetSov &svBenedict06Infiltrate; 'friend) ) ) ) )
; Create a Penitent ship for the player
(setq newShipObj (sysCreateShip &scAtonement; (objGetPos gPlayerShip) &svBenedict06Infiltrate; &evBenedict06PenitentShip;)) (msnSetData gSource 'penitentShipID (objGetID newShipObj))
; Install a reactor, because otherwise we're not going anywhere
(objAddItem newShipObj newReactor) (shpInstallDevice newShipObj newReactor) (objSetProperty newShipObj 'fuelLeft (objGetProperty newShipObj 'maxFuel))
; Install targeting ROM
(objChangeEquipmentStatus newShipObj 'TargetingComputer 'install)
; Switch ships ; ; We set the old ship to wait, which means autons stay with the old ship, ; but any enemies abort (otherwise, random encounters would attack the old ; ship).
(plyChangeShip gPlayer newShipObj { oldShipWaits: True })
; Set the sovereign because plyChangeShip always sets it to ; the default player sovereign.
(objSetSovereign newShipObj &svBenedict06Infiltrate;)
; Set the old player ship to dock at the station (and wait)
(shpCancelOrders oldShipObj) (shpOrder oldShipObj 'dock ownerObj)
; Update target
(msnSetPlayerTarget gSource) )
Events.OnObjDestroyed:
(switch
; If the Penitent station is destroyed before we dock, then ; we fail the mission.
(= (objGetID aObjDestroyed) (msnGetData gSource 'targetID)) (msnFailure gSource)
; If the Sisters station was destroyed then we remember that ; fact (though the mission can continue).
(= (objGetID aObjDestroyed) (msnGetProperty gSource 'ownerID))
(if (and gPlayerShip (= gPlayerShip aOrderGiver)) (msnSetData gSource 'sourceDestroyed 'byPlayer) (msnSetData gSource 'sourceDestroyed 'byEnemy) ) )
Events.OnDebriefed:
(block ( (ownerObj (objGetObjByID (msnGetProperty gSource 'ownerID))) (originalShipObj (objGetObjByID (msnGetData gSource 'playerShipID))) (penitentShipObj (objGetObjByID (msnGetData gSource 'penitentShipID))) )
(switch ; If we're not in the penitent ship, then do nothing: we've already ; switched. This can happen if we resurrect due to insurance.
(!= penitentShipObj gPlayerShip) Nil
; If the original ship is destroyed, then the Penitent ship ; becomes permanent, so we set the sovereign.
(not originalShipObj) (block () (objSetSovereign gPlayerShip &svPlayer;) )
; Switch back
(block ()
; Restore the player's ship
(plyChangeShip gPlayer originalShipObj)
; Set the sovereign of the Penitent ship so it is not attacked
(objSetSovereign penitentShipObj &svSistersOfDomina;)
; Leave the original Penitent ship at the Sisters (and eventually leave)
(shpCancelOrders penitentShipObj) (shpOrder penitentShipObj 'dock ownerObj) (shpOrder penitentShipObj 'wait 120) (shpOrder penitentShipObj 'gate) ) ) )
Events.OnGlobalSystemStarted:
(switch ; This mission is spawned in C6A, or C6 (if C6A does not exist). ; If we're not in the right node, then nothing to do.
(!= (sysGetNode) (if (find (sysGetNodes) 'C6A) 'C6A 'C6)) Nil
; If the mission isn't available, then nothing to do
(not (benedict_isMissionAvailable &msInfiltratePenitents;)) Nil
; If we've already gone through this setup code, then skip it. ; Otherwise we would keep creating stations whenever one got ; destroyed.
(typGetData &msInfiltratePenitents; 'setupDone) Nil
; Otherwise, prepare the system.
(block (penitentLoc)
; If there is a station here that can give the mission then ; we don't need to do anything (the player will automatically ; get the mission there). ; ; But otherwise we create a Sisters station
(if (not (or (sysFindObject Nil "TA +unid:&stCommonwealthColonyArmed;;") (sysFindObject Nil "TA +unid:&stSistersOfDomina;;") ))
; We create the station at an appropriate system location, or, if ; not found, at a random position.
(sysCreateStation &stSistersOfDomina; (or (@ (sysGetRandomLocation "-innerSystem; +planetary" { remove:True objType:&stSistersOfDomina; }) 'pos) (sysVectorRandom Nil (lambda () (random 300 900)) 60 "TAE" ) ) ) )
; If there isn't a Penitent Sanctum here, and if we have an ; appropriate location, then we create a Penitent station. ; ; If no appropriate location, then we just wait until mission ; accept to create the station.
(if (and (not (sysFindObject Nil "TA +unid:&stPenitentSanctum;;")) (setq pos (@ (sysGetRandomLocation "+nebulae" { remove:True objType:&stPenitentSanctum; }) 'pos)) ) (sysCreateStation &stPenitentSanctum; pos) )
(typSetData &msInfiltratePenitents; 'setupDone True) ) )
Events.OnInfiltrateDone:
(block ( (targetObj (objGetObjByID (msnGetData gSource 'targetID))) )
; Mission succeeds
(msnSuccess gSource)
; Stop that ship!
(objSendMessage gPlayerShip targetObj (msnTranslate gSource 'msgStopThatShip))
; Apply an overlay to the station to prevent it from firing. ; Otherwise the player will get killed instantly. ; ; When the overlay is done, we'll attack the player
(objAddOverlay targetObj &ovBenedict06Disarm; 120) )

Language.Text: Infiltrate a Penitent Sanctum

Help Benedict to infiltrate a Penitent Sanctum.
System: %systemName%\n Payment: None

Benedict greets you as you enter:
"%name%! I'm glad you're here! I've reconstructed the drive data from the medical ship. They deviated from their scheduled course to dock at a Penitent station in this system!"

"Not likely! Maybe Stormhound is right. I think Sister Elana Ston is hiding something. Whatever she was doing with the Penitents, maybe she got caught and had to scuttle the medical ship to erase the evidence."
"I've got an idea, but I need your help. Have you ever flown a Penitent ship?"
Language.String: "[I] don't like where this is going..."
Language.Text:
Benedict takes you around to another docking bay.
"I've had the Sisters refurbish a Penitent ship that we destroyed recently. We can use it to enter the Penitent Sanctum and find out what the medical ship was doing there.
"I really need you on this. Are you in?"
"Alright. Just get us to the Penitent station and I'll take care of the rest."
"OK, but don't take too long."
"What are we doing back here? We need to go to the Penitent station!"

Fiona and Sandoval meet you at the airlock.
Fiona looks past you at the ship, "Where's Benedict? He told us to meet him here."

You dock with the ruined station and see Fiona and Sandoval helping injured Sisters. Fiona walks towards you:
"It was an attack! You and Benedict are playing with fire and we're getting burned!"
She looks past you at the ship, "Where is he?"

You dock with the ruined station and see Fiona and Sandoval helping injured Sisters. Sandoval grabs you as you enter:
"What are you playing at! You deliberately attacked us!"
But Fiona interrupts him, "%He% didn't mean it, Sandoval! It was an accident.
"Where's Benedict?"

You give Fiona the video data ROM and tell her about Benedict staying behind.
Sandoval interrupts you, "If we leave now maybe we can get him out of there!"
But Fiona shakes her head, "How? Even if he's not dead already we'd have to blow the station to get him, and that could kill him too!"

Fiona continues, "And we don't know what's going on! Why is Sister Ston working with Penitents? Who were those children?
"Maybe if we figure it out we'll have some leverage to get Benedict out."

"We're going to Sanctuary. I've got enough to make Sister Ston talk.
"Meet us there and by then we might have a plan to rescue Benedict!"
Mission complete!
"What a shame! Now we'll never know why the medical ship was docking at the Penitents!"

(block ( (missionObj (@ (msnFind "* +unid:&msInfiltratePenitents;;") 0)) (originalShipObj (objGetObjByID (msnGetData missionObj 'playerShipID))) (penitentShipObj (objGetObjByID (msnGetData missionObj 'penitentShipID))) )

True ) ) )

Language.Text: Benedict does not want you to change ships.

You enter the Penitent docking bay with Benedict at your side. Dock workers in vacuum suits prep a handful of ships.
Benedict points to an elevated level that overlooks the entire bay, "That's where we're going."
Gray-garbed Penitents pass you as you head for the elevator. None look up from their datapads.

The door to the elevated level slides open into a control room. A tall, middle-aged man in a simple gray outfit looks up from his console as you enter.
"Who are you, please?"
The controller appears confused, "I just started my shift."

"Why aren't you wearing your wristband? Why are there two of you? And why haven't I seen you before..."
The Penitent suddenly heads towards a panel on the opposite wall, but Benedict intercepts him. He bashes the Penitent with his arm cannon, leaving him motionless on the floor.

The controller stares at both of you without speaking. Then he calmly looks down at his screen:
"Our scanner has been ionized. You'll need to depolarize the dish."

"Great!"
"Of course, you're in the wrong place. Everyone knows the scanner dish is in the central hub."
The Penitent suddenly heads towards a panel on the opposite wall, but Benedict intercepts him. He bashes the Penitent with his arm cannon, leaving him motionless on the floor.

"Where have I heard that before..."
The Penitent suddenly heads towards a panel on the opposite wall, but Benedict intercepts him. He bashes the Penitent with his arm cannon, leaving him motionless on the floor.

"We only have a few minutes," says Benedict, as he swipes around on the console. "Here it is! Docking bay video of when the medical ship docked."
The screen flickers to a recorded view of the docking bay. You see Sister Elana Ston step out of the medical ship. There is no sound, but you see her talking with a couple of Penitents in their monochrome suits.

Sister Ston walks back to her ship, and for several minutes nothing more happens. But then a dozen medtechs come out of the ship, each escorting a small gurney. They take the gurneys into the halls of the Penitent station and out of the camera frame.
Each gurney carries a small infant, wrapped in blankets, and hooked up to a monitoring pad.

Just then, you hear shouts from below and see a group of Penitents, weapons out, enter the docking bay.
Benedict hands you a data ROM, "Take this video back to Fiona! Don't trust anyone else. Go now!"

"I'll buy you some time. Don't argue! I've got a plan to leave in one piece.
"But just in case, tell Fiona that..."
A blast hits above your head, and you scramble towards the door. Benedict powers up his arm cannon and waves you through.
You hear deafening shots behind you as you make your way to the ship.
